title: Identify the Products
text: First, identify the products of the combustion reaction. Look at the right side of the equation to see what compounds are formed.

title: Count Carbon Atoms
text: Count the number of carbon atoms in the carbon dioxide (CO2) molecule. Remember, each CO2 molecule contains one carbon atom.

title: Count Hydrogen Atoms
text: Count the number of hydrogen atoms in the water (H2O) molecule. Each H2O molecule contains two hydrogen atoms.

title: Count Oxygen Atoms
text: Count the total number of oxygen atoms in both CO2 and H2O. Remember, CO2 has two oxygen atoms and H2O has one oxygen atom.

title: Verify Your Counts
text: Verify that you have counted the atoms correctly: $$1$$ carbon, $$2$$ hydrogen, and $$3$$ oxygen atoms on the products side.
